Context:
To be eligible for the Field Placement course (GRAF3017) in semester 6, students must have a GPA of .3 or higher by the end of semester 4 and a B+ on the portfolio assignment (semester 5, GRAF3014).

Graduates of this program will find employment in various digital media studios with careers such as: information architect, interaction designer, mobile designer, mobile developer, production artist, 3D visualization artist, motion designer, user experience designer, user interface developer, web designer, web developer, SEO/SEM specialist.

Required Courses:
Semester 1: INTR 1001 - 2D Visualization, INTR 1002 - Information Architecture 1, INTR 1003 - Visual Design, INTR 1005 - Technical Drawing 1, INTR 1006 - Interactive Systems, COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts.

Semester 2: INTR 1011 - 3D Visualization 1, INTR 1001, INTR 1012 - Information Architecture 2, INTR 1002, INTR 1013 - Information Design, INTR 1003, INTR 1015 - Technical Drawing 2, INTR 2004 - Usability Testing, INTR 1002, INTR 1007 - Design, Technology and Humans, INTR 1003.

Semester 3: INTR 1014 - Cognitive Ergonomics, INTR 2004 - Interface Development 1, INTR 1011, INTR 2002 - Interface Development 2, INTR 1012, INTR 2003 - Communicating Design, INTR 1013, INTR 2005 - Branding and Marketing Strategies.

Semester 4: INTR 2011 - 3D Visualization 3, INTR 2001, INTR 2012 - Interface Development 2, INTR 2002, INTR 2013, Physical Interfaces, INTR 2003 and INTR 1006, INTR 2016 - Design Process and Management.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Interaction Design Program G113 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
EXTRACTED INFORMATION:

SEMESTER 5:
- INTR 1006, INTR 2016: Design Process and Management
- INTR 2003: Ergonomics in Design
- General Education Elective (GNED)

Prerequisites:
- INTR 3002: Device Development 1
- INTR 2012, INTR 2013: Course names unspecified

SEMESTER 6:
- INTR 3012: Device Development 2
- INTR 3002, INTR 3018: Interactive Systems Project 2
- INTR 3008, INTR 3016, INTR 3018: Courses names unspecified
- INTR 3024: Interaction Design Studio Lab
- INTR 3006 or INTR 3030: Field Placement

Prerequisites:
- INTR 3002: Device Development 1
- INtr 3012: Device Development 2

General Education Electives are required.

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Collaborate in a team environment to design multi-disciplinary products and services
- Apply tools for designing, building, visualizing and programming digital interactive experiences
- Assess requirements of complex interactive media projects
- Plan development and execution of interaction design projects based on resource and budgetary requirements
- Design complex media projects using best practice principles and theoretical frameworks
- Make interactive products using appropriate technologies, materials, and manufacturing methods
- Perform work in compliance with regulations, legislation, security policies, industry standards, and codes of ethics
- Use research skills to assess and inform optimal digital user experience within interactive interfaces
- Apply creative and innovative thinking techniques to manage change and solve design problems
- Make recommendations based on human computer interaction.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Interaction Design Program G113 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text discusses a program at George Brown College that focuses on human computer interaction design and making recommendations based on HCI guidelines to improve user experiences. The program includes creating design solutions using strategies and methodologies, contributing to various interactive platforms, and designing interactive products or services.

The text also provides information on tuition fees for domestic and international students for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 and Fall 2023, respectively. The tuition amounts listed are for tuition, materials (non-refundable), student service and ancillary fees.

The program requires applicants to have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, a Grade 12 English credit, and submit a portfolio. Mature students may apply with alternative qualifications such as the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrading to achieve English credits.

The text also mentions that the information provided is subject to change and encourages prospective students to verify fee requirements directly with George Brown College. The program is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.

EXTRACTED INFORMATION:
- Program focuses on human computer interaction design
- Making recommendations based on HCI guidelines
- Creating design solutions using strategies and methodologies
- Contributing to various interactive platforms
- Designing interactive products or services
- Tuition fees for domestic students: $8,599.00 (for first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022)
- Tuition fees for international students: $20,549.00 (for first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023)
- Application requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, Grade 12 English credit, portfolio submission
- Mature student alternatives: Admissions Assessment for English, upgrading to achieve English credits
- Program fees subject to change
- OSAP funding approved for eligible applicants.
